intro: Alsomitra heterosperma, commonly known as the giant sphaerocarp, is a rare and unique member of the Hepaticaceae family. It is a liverwort that exhibits a distinctive morphology with a large, rounded thallus that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. The plant is characterized by its complex and intricate structure, featuring a central stem with lateral branches and specialized reproductive structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
